content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution, because: It is simple and entertaining, but it is somewhat more challenging than it seems, especially to be able to pass all the tests.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and easily understandable.

Thanks to help of 5DN1L and jddingemanse.
 Update V1.01 is ready.

Output 'If no characters are present, output None' -> why is that included, while there is no test/validator pair testing this? You can leave this command away (it unfairly benefits those simply ignoring this part / less carefully reading the statement, since they will not implement this and therefore will be faster/shorter).

And, do also implement the suggestions from 5DN1L; they are (almost) always relevant.

Input
* Please rewrite the section following the contribution guidelines as follows:

( https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines )

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for the number of characters.
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: A string [[CharacterName]] and an integer [[PowerLevel]], separated by a space, for the name of the character and their power level respectively.

Output
* Please change "A list" to "The names" to be more precise on what to output.

* Please format "None" as a {{constant}}.

* Please change "order:" to "order, one name per line", and delete "WarriorName1" and "WarriorName2".

Constraints
* Please delete the constraint. I don't think the time limits are the same for different programming languages in the case of clashes.

* Please add "1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 100" here.

* Suggest to add "[[CharacterName]] does not contain space characters."

* Suggest to add "1 ≤ [[PowerLevel]] < 2³²" here.

Stub generator
* Line 2: Please change "d" and "strong" to "CharacterName" and "PowerLevel" respectively for consistency with Input section.

Thanks.
No problem! I think you currently have constraints under the output section. Your output description has disappeared.

Output
* As mentioned by @jddingemanse, the lines you put in Output section should be moved to Constraints section.

* I can't remember what you originally wrote here, but it should be something like:
The name(s) of the character(s) who will win, one name per line. 

* Please mention the order which the names should be output in case of a tie.

Constraints
* Please delete the time constraint. I don't think the time limits are the same for different programming languages in the case of clashes.

Thanks.
